GeneralInformation.School Vision: Independent Learners, Confident Leaders, Caring Citizens
GeneralInformation.School Mission: To nurture Pasirians to have sound values, a passion for life and learning, and a global outlook
GeneralInformation.School Philosophy, Culture and Ethos: We believe that every child has the potential to learn and excel. We provide a nurturing environment with many opportunities to bring out the best in our students. We value every student's uniqueness and guide them to discover and nurture their individual strengths and talents. Anchored in our school core values, PRIZE (Pride, Responsibility, Integrity, Zeal, Empathy), we develop students holistically in the physical, aesthetic, social & moral, leadership and morale domains. Our students' successes over the years are due in large part to our caring and dedicated staff, as well as our strong Pasirian DNA - Respect, Collaboration,Innovation, Mindset of Excellence and Lifelong Learning.
GeneralInformation.Type of School: GOVERNMENT SCHOOL / CO-ED SCHOOL / SINGLE SESSION

School Distinctive Programmes.Humanities: Applied Learning in Humanities and Languages through Project DRIVE!
School Distinctive Programmes.Music & Performing Arts: Learning for Life Programme in Music and Performing Arts through SHINE@PRSS

SpecialProgrammes.Special Student Development Programmes O: We provide learning experiences that are Authentic,Integrated,Independent, Interactive and Reflective (AI3R) to engage all students. We develop critical thinking in our students through the use of the Elements of Thought as a school-wide approach. Our Applied Learning Programme in Humanities and Languages, Project DRIVE!, provide students with Diversity of Humanities subjects, Relevance of learning to real-world situations, Interest in reading and improved literacy, Value in applications using current affairs and career guidance, and the Environment and partnerships with external organisations to support their learning. Our Learning for Life Programme in Music and Performing Arts, SHINE@PRSS, enables Self-discovery of interests and abilities, Heritage and cultural appreciation, Interaction and collaborative learning, eNgagement in community outreach and partnership, and Excellence in artistic expressions. Our values-based Character and Citizenship Education programme serves to develop in students self-mastery (Sec 1), the ability to work with others (Sec 2), servant leadership (Sec 3), and the drive to fulfil their aspirations (Sec 4 and 5). To develop Pasirians into confident leaders, the Pegasus Programme equips them with important leadership skills and knowledge through tiered and progressive training, and multiple opportunities and platforms to perform leadership roles. Other programmes that further provide holistic learning experiences include the CCAs, level camps, learning journeys, overseas trips, Values in Action projects, elective modules, Youth Empowerment for Success (YES!) and Befrienders Mentoring programme.
